openAPIV3Schema.description: A ProviderConfigUsage indicates that a resource is using a ProviderConfig.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

providerConfigRef.description: ProviderConfigReference to the provider config being used.

resourceRef.description: ResourceReference to the managed resource using the provider config.

openAPIV3Schema.description: A ProviderConfigUsage indicates that a resource is using a ProviderConfig.

providerConfigRef.description: ProviderConfigReference to the provider config being used.

resourceRef.description: ResourceReference to the managed resource using the provider config.

openAPIV3Schema.description: A ProviderConfig configures a Helm 'provider', i.e. a connection to a particular

apiVersion.description: APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object. Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and may reject unrecognized values. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description: Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents. Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to. Cannot be updated. In CamelCase. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: A ProviderConfigSpec defines the desired state of a Provider.

credentials.description: Credentials used to connect to the Kubernetes API. Typically a kubeconfig file. Use InjectedIdentity for in-cluster config.

env.description: Env is a reference to an environment variable that contains credentials that must be used to connect to the provider.

name.description: Name is the name of an environment variable.

fs.description: Fs is a reference to a filesystem location that contains credentials that must be used to connect to the provider.

secretRef.description: A SecretRef is a reference to a secret key that contains the credentials that must be used to connect to the provider.

identity.description: Identity used to authenticate to the Kubernetes API. The identity credentials can be used to supplement kubeconfig 'credentials', for example by configuring a bearer token source such as OAuth.

env.description: Env is a reference to an environment variable that contains credentials that must be used to connect to the provider.

name.description: Name is the name of an environment variable.

fs.description: Fs is a reference to a filesystem location that contains credentials that must be used to connect to the provider.

secretRef.description: A SecretRef is a reference to a secret key that contains the credentials that must be used to connect to the provider.

status.description: A ProviderConfigStatus defines the status of a Provider.

items.description: A Condition that may apply to a resource.

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime is the last time this condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: A Message containing details about this condition's last transition from one status to another, if any.

reason.description: A Reason for this condition's last transition from one status to another.

status.description: Status of this condition; is it currently True, False, or Unknown?

type.description: Type of this condition. At most one of each condition type may apply to a resource at any point in time.
